publisher.publisher-name: Oxford University Press for The Society for Financial Studies

title-group.article-title: An Asset Pricing Approach to Liquidity Effects in Corporate Bond Markets

permissions.copyright-statement: Copyright © 2017 The Society for Financial Studies

abstract.p: We use an asset pricing approach to compare the effects of the liquidity level and liquidity risk on expected U.S. corporate bond returns. Using signed transaction data, we estimate effective transaction costs for bond portfolios by a repeat-sales method. We find that the liquidity level and exposure to equity market liquidity risk affect expected bond returns. In contrast, exposure to corporate bond liquidity shocks carries an economically negligible risk premium. A simulation study shows that it is unlikely that our results are driven by measurement error in betas or multicollinearity. We present a simple theoretical model that explains these findings.
